tit.cmt: NENAMI→NENNAMI（ねんなみなのでそのようにスペルしました）

sen.j: 念阿弥 慈恩（ねんなみ じおん、? - 没年不詳）は日本の南北朝時代 (日本)から室町時代にかけての剣客、禅僧。
sen.e: Jion NENAMI (dates of birth and death unknown) is an assassin and Zen monk in the period of the Northern and Southern Court (Japan) and the Muromachi period.
Jion NENAMI (dates of birth and death unknown) was a swordsman and Zen monk in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) and the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: 過去形にしました。「剣客」の訳を修正しました。用語統一リストに従い、Courtsと複数形にしました。
sen.e: Jion NENNAMI (dates of birth and death unknown) was a swordsman and Zen monk in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) and the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: NENAMI→NENNAMI（ねんなみなのでそのようにスペルしました）

sen.j: 剣術流派の源流のひとつである念流の始祖とされる。
sen.e: He is considered as the founder of Nen-ryu school, one of the origins of schools of swordplay.
He is considered as the founder of Nen-ryu school, one of the origins of swordplay schools.
sen.cmt: ofの数をひとつ減らしました。
sen.e: He is considered as the founder of Nen-ryu school, one of the origins of swordplay schools.

sen.j: 俗名、相馬四郎、諱は義元。
sen.e: His secular name was Shiro SOMA and his imina (real name) was Yoshimoto.
His secular name was Shiro SOMA and his imina (real name) was Yoshimoto.
His secular name was Shiro SOMA and his imina (real name) was Yoshimoto.

sen.j: 戒名、奥山慈恩または念阿上人。
sen.e: His Kaimyo (posthumous Buddhist name) was Jion Okuyama or Nena Shonin.
His Kaimyo (posthumous Buddhist name) was Jion Okuyama or Nena Shonin.
His Kaimyo (posthumous Buddhist name) was Jion Okuyama or Nena Shonin.

sen.j: 奥州相馬（福島県南相馬市）の生まれで、相馬左衛門尉 忠重の子。
sen.e: He was born in Oshu soma (Minami-soma City, Fukushima Prefecture) as a son of SOMA Saemon no jo Tadashige.
He was born in Oshu soma (Minami-soma City, Fukushima Prefecture) as a son of SOMA Saemon no jo Tadashige.
He was born in Oshu soma (Minami-soma City, Fukushima Prefecture) as a son of SOMA Saemon no jo Tadashige.

sen.j: 弟に赤松三首座がいる。
sen.e: His younger brother was Mitsushuza AKAMATSU.
sen.cmt: 「赤松三首座」読み方不明のため Mitsushuza AKAMATSUとしました。
sen.e: His younger brother was Mitsushuza AKAMATSU.
His younger brother was Mitsushuza AKAMATSU.

sen.j: 父忠重は新田義貞に仕えて戦功があったといわれるが、義元が5歳の時に殺された。
sen.e: His father, Tadashige, served Yoshisada NITTA and rendered distinguished service in the war, but he was killed when Yoshimoto was five years old.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His father, Tadashige, served Yoshisada NITTA and rendered distinguished service in the war, but he was killed when Yoshimoto was five years old.
His father, Tadashige, served Yoshisada NITTA and rendered distinguished service in the war, but he was killed when Yoshimoto was five years old.

sen.j: 乳母に匿われた義元は武州今宿に隠棲した。
sen.e: He was given a shelter by his nanny and lived in seclusion in Imajuku Bushu (Musashi Province).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was given a shelter by his nanny and lived in seclusion in Imajuku Bushu (Musashi Province).
He was given a shelter by his nanny and lived in seclusion in Imajuku Bushu (Musashi Province).

sen.j: 7歳のときに相州藤沢の遊行上人に弟子入りし、念阿弥と名付けられる。
sen.e: When he was seven, he became a disciple of yugyoshonin (a high-ranking monk who travel around for ascetic practices) and he was named NENAMI.
When he was seven, he became a disciple of yugyoshonin (a high-ranking monk who travels around for ascetic practices) and he was named Nenami.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除し、travelをtravelsと修正し、NENAMIを最初の文字のみ小文字にしました。
sen.e: When he was seven, he became a disciple of yugyoshonin (a high-ranking monk who travels around for ascetic practices) and he was named Nennami.
sen.cmt: NENAMI→NENNAMI（ねんなみなのでそのようにスペルしました）

sen.j: 念阿弥は父の敵討ちをめざして剣の修行を積んだ。
sen.e: He did ascetic practices of swordplay to take revenge for his father's death.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Nenami practiced swordplay to avenge his father's death.
sen.cmt: 主語を原文通りにし、asceticがやや不適切なので削除し、「父の敵討ち」の訳をすっきりさせました。
sen.e: Nennami practiced swordplay to avenge his father's death.
sen.cmt: NENAMI→NENNAMI（ねんなみなのでそのようにスペルしました）

sen.j: 10歳で上京、鞍馬山での修行中、異怪の人に出会って妙術を授かったという。
sen.e: It was said when he was ten, he went to Kyoto and while doing ascetic practices in Mt. Kurama, he met a spiritual creature and was given a secret magical swordplay.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is said that at the age of ten, he went to Kyoto, where he met a spiritual creature while doing practices in Mt. Kurama and was taught a secret magical swordplay.
sen.cmt: 原文が「という」と現在形なのでwas saidを現在形に変更し、that節以下を整理しました。
sen.e: It is said that at the age of ten, he went to Kyoto, where he met a spiritual creature while doing practices in Mt. Kurama and was taught a secret magical swordplay.

sen.j: 16歳のとき、鎌倉で寿福寺の神僧、栄祐から秘伝を授かった。
sen.e: When he was sixteen, he was given inherited secret swordplay from Eisuke, a Zen monk in Jufukuji-Temple in Kamakura.
When he was sixteen, he was given inherited secret swordplay from Eisuke, a monk in Jufuku-ji Temple in Kamakura.
sen.cmt: <http://www.weblio.jp/content/%E7%A4%BE%E5%83%A7>によると、「神僧＝社僧」はBuddhist monk in a shrineなどと訳せそうですが、原文に「寿福寺の」とあるので、単にmonkとしました。「寿福寺」の訳を仕様指示書にしたがって変更しました。
sen.e: When he was sixteen, he was given inherited secret swordplay from Eisuke, a monk in Jufuku-ji Temple in Kamakura.

sen.j: さらに5月、筑紫・安楽寺での修行において剣の奥義を感得した。
sen.e: Additionally, in May, he learned all the secrets of swordplay while doing ascetic practices in Anraku-ji Temple in Chikushi.
Additionally, in May, he learned all the secrets of swordplay while doing practices in Anraku-ji Temple in Chikushi.
Additionally, in May, he learned all the secrets of swordplay while doing practices in Anraku-ji Temple in Chikushi.

sen.j: このとき18歳。
sen.e: At that time, he was eighteen.
At that time, he was eighteen.
At that time, he was eighteen.

sen.j: 京の鞍馬山で修行したことから、「奥山念流」あるいは「判官流」といい、また、鎌倉で秘伝を授かったことから「鎌倉念流」ともいう。
sen.e: His school was called 'Okuyama Nen-ryu school' or 'Hangan-ryu school', because he did ascetic practices in Mt. Kurama or it was also called 'Kamakura Nen-ryu school', because he was given inherited secret swordplay in Kamakura.

His school was called 'Okuyama Nen-ryu school' ("okuyama" means "the heart of mountains") or 'Hangan-ryu school' because he did practices in Mt. Kurama in Kyoto, and it was also called 'Kamakura Nen-ryu school' because he was given inherited secret swordplay in Kamakura.
sen.cmt: becauseの前のカンマとasceticを削除し、「京の」を訳出し、orをandに変更してその前にカンマを加えました。直訳するだけですと、文の前半の因果関係が伝わりませんので、「奥山」の説明を加えました。なぜ「判官流」となるのかは不明なので、そちらはそのままにしてあります。
sen.e: His school was called 'Okuyama Nen-ryu school' ("okuyama" means "the heart of mountains") or 'Hangan-ryu school' because he did practices in Mt. Kurama in Kyoto, and it was also called 'Kamakura Nen-ryu school' because he was given inherited secret swordplay in Kamakura.

sen.j: 念阿弥は還俗して相馬四郎 義元と名乗った。
sen.e: He returned to secular life and called himself Shiro SOMA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He returned to secular life and called himself Shiro SOMA and Yoshimoto.
He returned to secular life and called himself Shiro SOMA and Yoshimoto.

sen.j: 奥州に帰郷して首尾良く父の仇敵を討つと再び禅門に入り、名を慈恩と改めた。
sen.e: After he went back to his hometown, Oshu Province and successfully took revenge for his father's death, he entered Zen Buddhism again and renamed Jion.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After he went back to his hometown, Oshu Province, and successfully avenged his father's death, he entered Zen Buddhism again and changed his name to Jion.
sen.cmt: 「仇敵を討つ」と「名を～改めた」の訳を修正しました。必要なカンマを加えました。
sen.e: After he went back to his hometown, Oshu Province, and successfully avenged his father's death, he entered Zen Buddhism again and changed his name to Jion.

sen.j: こののち諸国を巡って剣法を教え、晩年の、信州波合村（後の浪合村、現阿智村波合）に長福寺を建立、念大和尚と称した。
sen.e: Afterward, he traveled around and taught sowardplay and later, he built Chofuku-ji Temple in Namiai-mura, Shinshu Province (later, Nammiai-mura, present-day Achi-mura Namiai) and called himself Nendaiosho.

Afterward, he traveled around and taught swordplay, and later, he built Chofuku-ji Temple in Namiai-mura, Shinshu Province (later, Namiai-mura, present-day Achi-mura Namiai), and called himself Nendaiosho.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを直し、カンマを加えました。
sen.e: Afterward, he traveled around and taught swordplay, and later, he built Chofuku-ji Temple in Namiai-mura, Shinshu Province (later, Namiai-mura, present-day Achi-mura Namiai), and called himself Nendaiosho.

sen.j: 没年は不明である。
sen.e: The date of death is unknown.
The year of his death is unknown.
The year of his death is unknown.

sen.j: 長福寺のあった麻利支天山（現念流山）の中腹には、江戸時代に樋口定雄（馬庭念流16世、十郎右衛門）が建てた念大和尚の石碑が残る。
sen.e: In the middle of Mt.Marishiten (present-day Mt. Nen-ryu) where Chofuku-ji Temple was located, the stone monument of Nendaiosho was erected by Sadao HIGUCHI (16th of Maniwanen-ryu school, Juro Uemon).

In the middle of Mt.Marishiten (present-day Mt. Nen-ryu), where Chofuku-ji Temple was located, the stone monument of Nendaiosho was erected by Sadao HIGUCHI (16th of Maniwanen-ryu school, Juro Uemon).
sen.cmt: whereの前にカンマを加えました。
sen.e: In the middle of Mt.Marishiten (present-day Mt. Nen-ryu), where Chofuku-ji Temple was located, the stone monument of Nendaiosho was erected by Sadao HIGUCHI (16th of Maniwanen-ryu school, Juro Uemon).

sen.j: 馬庭念流宗家の樋口家に伝わる『樋口家文書』や間光延が著わした『剣術系図』によれば、慈恩には板東8名、京6名、計14名の優れた門弟があったとした。
sen.e: According to "Higuchi ke Bunsho" (the history of the Higuchi family) handed down in Soke (the head family) of Maniwanen-ryu school and "Kenjutsu keizu" (the genealogy of swordplay) written by Mitsunobu HAZAMA, Jion had the total number of 14 excellent disciples, 8 of them were in Bando (present-day Kanto) Province and 6 of them were in Kyo (present-day Kyoto).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to "Higuchi ke Bunsho" (the Higuchi family's document) handed down in the Higuchi family, the head family of Maniwanen-ryu school, and "Kenjutsu Keizu" (the histories of swordsmen) written by Mitsunobu HAZAMA, Jion had the total of 14 excellent disciples, 8 of whom were in Bando (present-day the Kanto region), and 6 of whom were in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: ２つの資料の説明を変更しました。「板東」（坂東）の訳を変更し、「京」は単にKyotoとしました。numberを削除し、themをwhomに修正しました。
sen.e: According to "Higuchi ke Bunsho" (the Higuchi family's document) handed down in the Higuchi family, the head family of Maniwanen-ryu school, and "Kenjutsu Keizu" (the histories of swordsmen) written by Mitsunobu HAZAMA, Jion had the total of 14 excellent disciples, 8 of whom were in Bando (present-day the Kanto region), and 6 of whom were in Kyoto.

sen.j: 彼らは、「十四哲」と称される。
sen.e: They were called 'Juyontetsu' (the fourteen best disciples).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They were called 'Juyontetsu' (the fourteen best disciples).
They were called 'Juyontetsu' (the fourteen best disciples).

sen.j: 綿谷雪の『日本剣豪100選』では主な門人を次のとおり挙げているが、これについては疑問視する意見もある。
sen.e: "Nihon kengo hyakusen" (the 100 best swordsmen in Japan) written by Kiyoshi WATATANI shows major disciples as follows, but there is some doubt about it.
"Nihon kengo hyakusen" (the 100 best swordsmen in Japan) written by Kiyoshi WATATANI shows the major disciples as follows, but some people doubt the list.
sen.cmt: majorの前にtheを付けました。「これについては～」の訳を変更しました。
sen.e: "Nihon kengo hyakusen" (the 100 best swordsmen in Japan) written by Kiyoshi WATATANI shows the major disciples as follows, but some people doubt the list.

sen.j: なお、猿御前という人物については未詳である。
sen.e: Additionally, details about Saru no Gozen has been unknown.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Details about Saru no Gozen is unknown.
sen.cmt: Additionallyは誤訳で、訳さない方が分かりやすいので削除しました。現在形にしました。
sen.e: Details about Saru no Gozen is unknown.

sen.j: 通常、陰流開祖は愛洲久忠とされており猿御前との関係は不明である。
sen.e: Usually, Hisatada AISU is considered as the founder of Kage-ryu school and how Saru no Gozen related with Kage-ryu school has been unknown.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Usually, Hisatada AISU is considered as the founder of Kage-ryu school, but how Saru no Gozen was related to Kage-ryu school has not been discovered.
sen.cmt: カンマを加え、andをbutに変更し、relatedを受け身に修正し、「不明である」の訳を前文と重ならないようにするため変更しました。
sen.e: Usually, Hisatada AISU is considered as the founder of Kage-ryu school, but how Saru no Gozen was related to Kage-ryu school has not been discovered.

sen.j: また、沼田法印は丹石流の遠祖とされるが、『本朝武芸小伝』では丹石流は東軍流系とされている。
sen.e: Also, Hoin NUMATA is considered as the forefather of Tanseki-ryu school, but "Honcho Bugei Shoden" (a survey of traditional Japanese martial arts) mentioned that Tanseki-ryu school was a group of Togun-ryu school.

Also, Hoin NUMATA is considered as the founder of Tanseki-ryu school, but "Honcho Bugei Shoden" (a survey of traditional Japanese martial arts) mentions that Tanseki-ryu school was a group of Togun-ryu school.
sen.cmt: forefatherは「（人の）祖先」を指すため誤訳となってしまうので変更しました。mentionを現在形にしました。
sen.e: Also, Hoin NUMATA is considered as the founder of Tanseki-ryu school, but "Honcho Bugei Shoden" (a survey of traditional Japanese martial arts) mentions that Tanseki-ryu school was a group of Togun-ryu school.

sen.j: また、綿谷雪・山田忠史編纂の『増補大改訂 武芸流派大事典』の「念流」の項（683 - 685ページ）に『樋口家文書』と間光延の『剣術系図』に記された門人名の比較が掲載されている。
sen.e: Moreover, the article of 'nenryu' (page 683-685) of "Zohodaikaitei Bugeiryuha daijiten" (Enlarged revision encyclopedia of schools of traditional Japanese martial arts) compiled by Kiyoshi WATATANI and Tadashi YAMADA showed comparison between the names of disciples written in "Higuchi ke bunsho" and those in "Kenjutsu keizu" written by Mitsunobu HAZAMA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 「山田忠史」の読み方不明のため、「Tadashi YAMADA 」としました。
sen.e: Moreover, the section of 'Nenryu' (pages 683-685) of "Zohodaikaitei Bugeiryuha daijiten" (the enlarged and revised encyclopedia of schools of traditional Japanese martial arts) compiled by Kiyoshi WATATANI and Tadashi YAMADA shows the comparison between the names of disciples written in "Higuchi ke bunsho" and those in "Kenjutsu keizu" written by Mitsunobu HAZAMA.
sen.cmt: 「項」と「増補大改訂」の訳を変更し、showを現在形にしました。
sen.e: Moreover, the section of 'Nenryu' (pages 683-685) of "Zohodaikaitei Bugeiryuha daijiten" (the enlarged and revised encyclopedia of schools of traditional Japanese martial arts) compiled by Kiyoshi WATATANI and Tadashi YAMADA shows the comparison between the names of disciples written in "Higuchi ke bunsho" and those in "Kenjutsu keizu" written by Mitsunobu HAZAMA.

sen.j: 『剣術系図』には猿御前・沼田法印・樋口太郎兼重の名前は記されていない。
sen.e: In 'Kenjutsu keizu", the names of Saru no Gozen, Hoin NUMATA and Taro Kaneshige HIGUCHI were not written.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In "Kenjutsu keizu," the names of Saru no Gozen, Hoin NUMATA and Taro Kaneshige HIGUCHI are not written.
sen.cmt: ' を " に変更し、keizuの後のカンマの位置を変え、現在形にしました。
sen.e: In "Kenjutsu keizu," the names of Saru no Gozen, Hoin NUMATA and Taro Kaneshige HIGUCHI are not written.

sen.j: 二階堂右馬助（二階堂流）
sen.e: Umanosuke NIKAIDO (Nikaido-ryu school)
Umanosuke NIKAIDO (Nikaido-ryu school)
Umanosuke NIKAIDO (Nikaido-ryu school)

sen.j: 赤松三首座（念首座流、正法念流）
sen.e: Mitsushuza AKAMATSU (Nenshuza-ryu school, Shobonen-ryu school)
sen.cmt: 「赤松三首座」の読み方不明のため、「Mitsushuza AKAMATSU 」としました。
sen.e: Mitsushuza AKAMATSU (Nenshuza-ryu school, Shobonen-ryu school)
Mitsushuza AKAMATSU (Nenshuza-ryu school, Shobonen-ryu school)

sen.j: 堤宝山（宝山流）
sen.e: Hozan TSUTSUMI (Hozan-ryu school)
Hozan TSUTSUMI (Hozan-ryu school)
Hozan TSUTSUMI (Hozan-ryu school)

sen.j: 中条判官（中条流）
sen.e: Hangan CHUJO (Chujo-ryu school)
Hangan CHUJO (Chujo-ryu school)
Hangan CHUJO (Chujo-ryu school)

sen.j: 甲斐筑前守（中条流、富田流）
sen.e: Kai Chikuzen no kami (governor of Chikuzen in Kai Province) (Chujo-ryu school, Tomita-ryu school)
Kai Chikuzen no kami (governor of Chikuzen in Kai Province) (Chujo-ryu school, Tomita-ryu school)
Kai Chikuzen no kami (governor of Chikuzen in Kai Province) (Chujo-ryu school, Tomita-ryu school)

sen.j: 猿御前（陰流）
sen.e: Saru no gozen (Kage-ryu school)
Saru no gozen (Kage-ryu school)
Saru no gozen (Kage-ryu school)

sen.j: 沼田法印（丹石流）
sen.e: Hoin NUMATA (Tanseki-ryu school)
Hoin NUMATA (Tanseki-ryu school)
Hoin NUMATA (Tanseki-ryu school)

sen.j: 樋口太郎兼重（樋口念流）
sen.e: Taro Kaneshige HIGUCHI (Higuchinen-ryu school)
Taro Kaneshige HIGUCHI (Higuchinen-ryu school)
Taro Kaneshige HIGUCHI (Higuchinen-ryu school)
